intro: Trichera collina, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed and have a rough texture. Trichera collina thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments.
